course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Introduction to Biosensors and Bioinstrumentation
course.description: This course builds on the fundamental knowledge of biosensors and bioinstrumentation. Lectures and hands-on laboratory experiments cover: (1) Basic concepts of biomedical signal analysis; (2) Measurements of bioelectrical, biomechanical and biochemical signals for medical diagnosis and clinical monitoring; (3) Principles of biosensors and biochips; (4) Simple design of new bioinstrumentation and biosensor to solve biomedical problems.
course.prerequisites: ELEC 2400 OR ELEC 2420

reviews.author: cychiuaj
reviews.comment_content:
COURSE OUTLINES:
  I. INTRODUCTION: OVERVIEW OF COURSE
1. Types of medical electronic devices
2. General characteristics of biomedical signals
II. BASIC CONCEPTS
1. Mathematical descriptions of random signals
2. Measurement systems fundamentals
• Transduction
• Signal processing methods
• Close loop systems
• Equipment specifications
III. BIOPOTENTIALS
1. Origin: Ionic currents in a single cell
2. Action potentials (nerve and muscle)
3. Multiple cells: Generation of body-surface potentials
4. Electrocardiography (ECG)
• Physiology of the heart
• Dipole concept
• Lead systems
• Electrodes, amplifiers
• ECG instrument design (First lab assignment)
5. Electromyography (EMG)
6. Electroencephalography (EEG)
IV. BLOOD PRESSURE AND FLOW MEASUREMENT
1. Physiology of the circulatory system
2. Pressure transducers (invasive)
• Strain-gauge (1-,2-,4-arm bridges)
• Inductive
• Capacitive
• Piezoelectric
• Optical

3. Non-invasive pressure monitoring
• Manual cuff
• Oscillometric (Second lab assignment)
4. Flow measurement
• Indicator-dilution method (dye, thermal)
• Electromagnetic
• Doppler ultrasound
V. RESPIRATORY MONITORS
1. Physiology of blood/gas exchange
2. Capnography
3. Oximetry (Third lab assignment)
VI. CLINICAL CHEMISTRY and INTEGRATED BIOSENSORS
1. Spectrometry
2. Electrochemical sensors and Hematology counting

3. Integrated and smart sensors
5. Biochip for clinical diagnostics
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor has tried to explain the biological concept with a lot of examples and detailed information. the content is relatively difficult and costs a lot of time especially for those who have no biological knowledge such as cell membrane and the heart. but there is no tutorial session, so the only way is to ask the prof. directly or searching from the internet.

some content will not be explained in class which requires you to read the handout. some handout is really long and too difficult to understand.

No attendance required. According to the situation, all labs will have videos and data support, attendance for labs is optional.

the TAs' response in around 2-3 hours, which is quick enough.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:  

Homework      (15%)
Lab reports:    (15%)
Midterm          (20%)  (max: 20+4bonus)
Final               (50%)

it is a small class, so there are only a few people can get A range, and the B range is relatively wide. I think it is pretty fair compare to other small class courses.

My grade is A-, which homework ~80%, lab reports ~90%, midterm 16.5
the final score is not released, but I think it should be similar to the midterm. As mentioned, it is a small class, so A range will be much difficult, but overall is still fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, the assignments and labs workload is normal, one assignment per week up to midterm, and one lab report per week starting after the midterm. Total 6 assignments and 6 labs. the most time consuming maybe the first assignment if you are not familiar with Matlab. the code for data analysis used in the assignment will be reused in each lab report. for each report and assignment, around 3 hours will be spent, therefore it is around 3 hours workload per week, which is fair for a 4 cred course.


the instructor claim that you just need to have some basic circuits knowledge to study this course, so you do not need to have bio knowledge.

but the main problem is the content is not familiar for most of the students which is very difficult. if you really want to understand the course materials, you have to spend a lot of time self-learning and revise. for those who have not much biological knowledge, it is a hard time until you get familiar with the content. therefore, it is not a suitable course for those not interested in this area and not good at bio-content.

There are no tutorial lesson which makes you difficult to apply the knowledge into real time example (Exam and mid-term question).

The final grade is really bad. Normally, small number of class always have nice grading(absolute grading). However, you won’t see it in this course.  

The workload is too high but the B range is too wide. So difficult to achieve A range compare other ELEC courses.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty high. There are homework every week when the semester start. After the lab begin, you have to do the lab report every week which really time consuming. You have to spend more than normal 4 credit class to understand the materials and finish the homework. I do not recommend to take these course to fulfil the elective requirement unless you really want go deep in this area.

reviews.author: Davidliu
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces electrical and physics students to the concepts underlying the design of medical electronic devices. Methods for acquiring and processing signals from the human body are studied mostly at the system level, but practical examples of the circuit-level design of medical devices are also presented. After completing this course, one should understand the biophysical origins of the electrocardiogram, the blood pressure pulse, and other major diagnostic variables and be able to design systems to measure them.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture will cover a lot of information and explanation that is not included in the notes. So attending the lecture is very very important. Also, it would be easy for students to understand the concept in this course if they have biological knowledge background. Professor will explain the concepts and calculation during the lectures before the experiments.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments and five experiments. There is one week for doing the assignment. A report is needed to submit after each experiment. However, the experiments are usually similar except the finding. You may feel stressful if you also take other ELEC3XXX or ELEC4XXX, because there must be assignment or lab report need to submit in every week.
